rules: Rule1: Provided that the team publishes a study, the research is valid.
Rule2: If a journal accepts a paper, then whenever a panel peer-reviews that paper, the research is valid.
Rule3: Under the condition that a conference accepts a paper, then if a panel peer-reviews that paper, the research is valid.
Rule4: In case a journal requires a fee, then given that neither a journal accepts a paper nor a conference accepts a paper, it follows that a publication is not delayed.
Rule5: Supposing a conference requires a fee, then if it is not the case that a journal accepts a paper or a conference accepts a paper, a publication is not delayed.
Rule6: If the team measures a pollution level, the research is valid.
Rule7: Whenever the team estimates a pollution level, the research is valid.
Rule8: If the team analyzes a chemical, then the team identifies a contaminant.
Rule9: The team analyzes a chemical or the team collects a sample.
Rule10: In case a sensor monitors a river, then the sensor detects a pollutant.
Rule11: Whenever a sensor detects a pollutant, the sensor transmits data.
Rule12: If a sensor triggers an alert, the research is valid.
Rule13: In case a technician calibrates a sensor, then if the sensor detects a pollutant, the sensor triggers an alert.
Rule14: A technician calibrates a sensor or a technician tests a sensor.
Rule15: If a technician tests a sensor, then a supervisor verifies the sensor.
Rule16: Supposing a director approves a procedure, then if a supervisor verifies a sensor, then given that the sensor detects a pollutant, the sensor triggers an alert.
Rule17: If the team collects a sample, then the team publishes a study.
Rule18: In case a lab verifies a contaminant, then whenever the team identifies a contaminant, the team publishes a study.
Rule19: If a project lacks funding, then given that it is not the case that if the team analyzes a chemical then the team publishes a study, the results are inconclusive.
Rule20: A project lacks funding or a project lacks equipment.
Rule21: Under the condition that a project lacks equipment, then if it is not the case that provided the team analyzes a chemical the team publishes a study, the results are inconclusive.
Rule22: A protocol is violated or the team uses an instrument.
Rule23: Provided that an agency audits the team, then a protocol is not violated.
Rule24: An agency audits the team or a committee investigates the team.
Rule25: Supposing a board exonerates the team, then if a committee investigates the team, a protocol is not violated.
Rule26: In case an institution issues an apology, then an institution demands a retraction.
Rule27: If the team writes a report, then the team publishes a study.

Rule28: Provided that the team acknowledges an error, then given that it is not the case that the community disputes the findings or that if the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level then the data are not inaccurate, an institution issues an apology.
Rule29: Under the condition that the team corrects an error, then the team acknowledges an error.
Rule30: If a database entry is updated, then the team corrects an error.
Rule31: A database entry is updated or a paper entry is retracted.
Rule32: Whenever a paper entry is retracted, the team corrects an error.

Rule33: Provided that a study cites a source, then if it is not the case that if the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level then data are missing, the study is not unreliable.
Rule34: A study cites a source or a study references a source.

Rule35: Supposing a study references a source, then given that it is not the case that if the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level then data are missing, the study is not unreliable.
Rule36: In case the team uses an instrument, then whenever the team analyzes a chemical, the team writes a report.
Rule37: Provided that a funder awards a grant, then a funder compensates the team.
Rule38: Under the condition that the team submits a paper, then a review confirms a finding.
Rule39: The team submits a paper or a panel peer-reviews a paper.
Rule40: Whenever it is not the case that a journal accepts a paper or a conference accepts a paper, a publication is delayed.
Rule41: If it is not the case that a journal requires a fee or a conference requires a fee, then a publisher has open access.
Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that the team measures a pollution level or estimates a pollution level, then data are inaccurate.

Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the case that the community disputes the findings or that whenever the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level the data are not inaccurate, then an institution does not demand a retraction.
Rule44: In case it is not the case that provided the team analyzes a chemical the team publishes a study, then results are not inconclusive.
Rule45: If it is not the case that if a sensor transmits data then the research is valid, then a data packet is lost.
Rule46: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level then data are missing, then a study is unreliable.

Rule47: In case it is not the case that if the community does not dispute the findings or that if the team does not measure a pollution level or estimate a pollution level then the data are not inaccurate, then an institution demands a retraction, then the team issues a correction.
Rule48: If it is not the case that whenever a sensor does not transmit data the research is valid, then a data packet is not lost, then a funder awards a grant.
Rule49: Under the condition that a director does not approve a procedure, then a project is halted.
Rule50: Supposing the team does not use an instrument, then the team borrows an instrument.
facts: Fact1: A sensor monitors a river.
Fact2: A lab verifies a contaminant.
Fact3: A board exonerates the team.
Fact4: It is not the case that a publisher has open access.
Fact5: The community does not dispute the findings.
Fact6: The team does not issue a correction.
Fact7: A project is not halted.
Fact9: A funder does not compensate the team.
Fact10: The team does not borrow an instrument.
Fact11: A review does not confirm a finding.
